definition: a sacrament admitting a baptized person to full participation in the church
details:
noun
- a sacrament admitting a baptized person to full participation in the church
- a ceremony held in the synagogue (usually at Pentecost) to admit as adult members of the Jewish community young men and women who have successfully completed a course of study in Judaism
- additional proof that something that was believed (some fact or hypothesis or theory) is correct
= example: additional proof that something that was believed (some fact or hypothesis or theory) is correct
= synonyms: check
- information that confirms or verifies
- making something valid by formally ratifying or confirming it
= synonyms: ratification
